title: Mahabharata | Part 39 | Durvasa causes anxiety to the Pandavas | His Grace Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.key_quote: In the last episode, we have seen how Durvasamuni had come to the hermitage of the Pandavas with his 10,000 disciples at a time when Draupadi had finished her meal.
segments.summary: The speaker summarizes the previous episode, setting the stage for the current narrative about Durvasa Muni's visit and the Pandavas' predicament.

segments.key_quote: Like this narada mani went from palace to palace in every palace he saw krishna was personally present and engaged in some activity or the other
segments.summary: The speaker narrates an incident in Dwaraka where Narada Muni witnesses Krishna's simultaneous presence in multiple palaces, highlighting Krishna's supreme nature.

segments.key_quote: But Krishna can be present in multiple places at the same time and still he remains the individual that he is.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Krishna's unique ability to be present in multiple places simultaneously, emphasizing his supremacy and transcendence of limitations.

segments.key_quote: That Krishna who was in Dwaraka with Rukmini Devi, he heard Draupadi's prayer and he immediately rushed out of his room
segments.summary: The speaker transitions back to the Pandavas' story, describing how Draupadi's desperate prayer to Krishna in the forest prompts Krishna to immediately appear and offer assistance.

segments.key_quote: Krishna becomes completely satisfied when his devotee offers him something with love and affection.
segments.summary: The speaker narrates how Krishna, despite the dire situation, asks for food and is satisfied by the small offering of leftover sabji from Draupadi, emphasizing the importance of devotion over material offerings.

segments.key_quote: Krishna rescued the Pandavas from the danger of of Durvasamuni's anger and curse
segments.summary: The speaker describes how Krishna instructs Sahadeva to call Durvasa Muni, and miraculously, Durvasa and his disciples suddenly feel full and decide to leave, relieving the Pandavas from a potentially disastrous situation.

segments.key_quote: What exactly caused the Durvasamuni and his disciples to lose their hunger
segments.summary: The speaker concludes the episode by highlighting the mysterious nature of Durvasa Muni and his disciples suddenly losing their hunger after bathing, setting up the next episode to explore the reason behind this event.
